result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adelin Castineiras Massallo in court with attorney Awni M Yasin via telephone, due to illness.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. State advised that corporation counsel does not wish to proceed with case as Chapter 51. State motions to suspend proceedings indefinitely. Defense does not object. Court grants state's request. Court orders that case suspended indefinitely. Defense to peitition court at later date regarding bail.

Defendant Adelin Castineiras Massallo in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Vicki Bermudez. CMC. Doctor's report previously filed. Defendant found not competent and unlikely to regain competency. State requests a status conference to contact corporation counsel.  Case is adjourned to Br. 31.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Doctor's Report with cover letter.

Defendant Adelin Castineiras Massallo in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado

Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest  Doctors Report dated 12-20-16.  Court ordered defendant to continue participation in the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program, as recommended.  Review hearing scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Examining psychologist's report dated 12-20-16 by Dr. Rawski.
Received and Filed:  Report Dated 11-23-16 by Dr. Lundbohm.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Adelin Castineiras Massallo in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for doctor's report return.  There being no challenges to the report from Dr. Robert Rawski by the state, defense or defendant, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  
The defendant is committed on 9/13/16 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Court requests that defendant participate in the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program, as recommended by Dr. Robert Rawski.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 31.  Review hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adelin Castineiras Massallo in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense waived the Spanish interpreter for purposes of today's scheduling and defense request time to review the report with the defendant.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 31.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Dr. Rawski's report dated 9/8/2016, received and filed

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31. Defendant has appoinment for examination on 08/23/2016 at 12:00 pm, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Rawski.
